diseases.name: Early Blight
symptoms: Dark brown spots with concentric rings (target-like) on older lower leaves
Yellow halo around spots
Spots enlarge and coalesce
Premature leaf drop
Dark lesions on stems and fruits

favorable_conditions.weather: Warm, humid conditions with heavy dew

diseases.immediate_action: Remove and destroy infected leaves immediately to prevent spread

organic: Neem oil spray 5ml per liter water - Apply weekly
Baking soda solution (1 tablespoon per liter) with liquid soap
cultural: Improve air circulation by proper spacing
Stake plants to keep foliage off ground

prevention: Crop rotation with non-solanaceous crops for 2-3 years
Apply mulch to prevent soil-borne infection
Maintain proper plant spacing (75 x 60 cm)
Water at soil level, avoid wetting foliage
Apply balanced fertilizer - avoid excess nitrogen

diseases.name: Late Blight
diseases.severity: Very High - Can destroy entire crop
symptoms: Water-soaked, dark green to brown spots on leaves
White fuzzy growth on underside of leaves (in humid conditions)
Rapid spread throughout plant
Dark brown to black lesions on stems
Firm, brown spots on green fruits

favorable_conditions.weather: Cool, wet, cloudy conditions with extended leaf wetness

diseases.immediate_action: URGENT: Spray fungicide immediately. Remove severely infected plants.

organic: Copper-based fungicides (Bordeaux mixture 1% or Copper oxychloride 3g/L)
Act quickly - organic treatments less effective once established
chemical: Apply at 7-10 day intervals in disease-prone periods
cultural: Burn or bury infected material deep
Apply preventive sprays before disease appears

prevention: Start preventive fungicide program before symptoms appear
Monitor weather - spray before cool, wet periods
Remove volunteer potato and tomato plants nearby
diseases.yield_loss: Can destroy 100% of crop within days

diseases.name: Blast
symptoms: Diamond-shaped spots on leaves with gray centers and brown borders
Spindle-shaped lesions on leaf blades
Eye-shaped spots on leaf sheath
Neck rot causing panicle to break
Rotting of nodes

favorable_conditions.weather: Cloudy, humid weather with intermittent rain

diseases.immediate_action: Apply systemic fungicide immediately, drain excess water

cultural: Apply potash fertilizer to strengthen plants

prevention: Treat seeds with Tricyclazole before sowing
Maintain proper water level (not too deep)
diseases.yield_loss: Up to 70% if neck blast occurs

diseases.name: Brown Spot
symptoms: Small, circular to oval brown spots on leaves
Spots have gray center with brown margin
Numerous spots on leaves causing them to dry
Symptoms on glumes reduce grain quality
diseases.immediate_action: Apply balanced fertilizer especially potash, spray fungicide

diseases.name: Rust (Leaf, Stem, Stripe)
symptoms: Yellow-orange powdery pustules on leaves (Leaf rust)
Reddish-brown pustules on stem and leaf sheath (Stem rust)
Yellow stripes on leaves (Stripe rust)
Pustules rupture releasing orange spores
Severe infection causes premature leaf death
diseases.immediate_action: Spray fungicide at first sign of rust pustules
prevention: Monitor fields regularly during cool, moist weather
Preventive fungicide spray in disease-prone areas

diseases.name: Late Blight
diseases.severity: Very High - Can destroy entire field
symptoms: Water-soaked, dark green spots on leaf tips and margins
White moldy growth on leaf undersides in humid conditions
Rapid browning and death of foliage
Dark brown dry rot on tubers
Foul smell from infected tubers

favorable_conditions.weather: Cool nights, warm days, high humidity, rainfall

diseases.immediate_action: URGENT: Spray metalaxyl immediately. Consider emergency harvest.

chemical: Apply every 7-10 days in favorable conditions
cultural: Harvest when disease detected, cure tubers

prevention: Remove cull piles and volunteer plants

diseases.name: Bacterial Blight
symptoms: Water-soaked angular spots on leaves
Spots turn black with yellow halo
Leaf blight and defoliation
Black arm: long black lesions on stem and branches
Boll rot with bacterial ooze

favorable_conditions.weather: Warm, humid with frequent rains and strong winds

diseases.immediate_action: Remove infected plants, apply copper spray immediately

chemical: Bactericides have limited effectiveness - focus on prevention

prevention: Treat seeds with streptocycline before sowing
Control boll weevils and other insects

diseases.name: Panama Disease (Fusarium Wilt)
diseases.severity: Very High - Soil persists for decades
symptoms: Yellowing of older leaves progressing to younger leaves
Splitting of leaf sheaths at base
Wilting and drooping of leaves
Reddish-brown discoloration of vascular tissue when pseudostem cut
Plant death before or after fruiting
diseases.immediate_action: Remove infected plant completely including rhizome. Quarantine area.

chemical: Preventive: Carbendazim soil drench for healthy plants
cultural: Remove entire infected plant and rhizome
Do not replant in same spot for 5-10 years

prevention: Plant only disease-free tissue culture plants
Avoid movement of soil from infected areas
diseases.yield_loss: 100% for infected plants, can affect entire plantation
